The only reason why I bought this game was because I had the itch for basketball and I don't have access to a court so this was the next best thing. I haven't played 2K in at least 3 years so I didn't even remember the controls so it was similar to an experience for a new player for the most part. BTW, this is my experience from just a MyCareer perspective as I don't play the other modes, especially MyTeam considering its just gambling with a large amount of grind if you want anything and not spend money on it. 

First off, I'm not particularly happy they didn't give PC next gen, but it isn't a huge deal breaker to me. From what I do remember from the last time I played 2K was the terrible scripting of your actions and how the game would go and it's still here, ready to frustrate you. You feel like you have absolutely no effect on the games whatsoever no matter how well you do. Want to cut to the basket? Nope, you'll get pushed around until you pick up your dribble and have to pass it away forcing you to do pick and roll offense the entire time as you can never trust your team to make any shots while you're on the floor if you're on the highest difficulty. Even if you actually don't get pushed around, you could still just lose the ball for no reason and this is true until very high level ball control and using a few badges just to not randomly get a turnover. It also seems every year, they make the starting point even worst than the last. I remember when you could start a new player in MyCareer and immediately be around 68, but now you start at 60 with a speed and acceleration rating of a center at every position making the progression for college a brutal game of trying to find ways to cheese the game or just caving and buying VC to make your character even somewhat decent and that will only get you so far (I know, I tried, foolishly). 

When it comes to shooting, they definitely lost their touch. If you actually want to be a good shooter, yo're gonna need some really good stats and badges are an absolute must if you want to be just okay. You'll also need defensive badges to make any difference there too as off-ball defense is atrocious without ANOTHER badge and people can blow right past you whenever they desire. 

Overall, the game is just more stress than anything else and has little to no actual fun, just addicting gameplay loops and frustration for simple game mechanics and how they don't work almost every time. All I can say at this point is that I'm glad I bought it on sale for $10, but with how this game is and all the microtransactions it throws at you, it isn't even worth the $10 I spent. Only goods thing I guess I can come with is the music is okay, the graphics are pretty good and character customization is really in depth, thats it. 2/10

In conclusion, while NBA 2k22 may appeal to basketball fans and casual gamers alike with its impressive graphics and mechanics, it ultimately falls short in terms of its overall design and content. I bought this game because it was 67% off; and I figured that paying 30 dollars for a roster update was an acceptable price.
However, this game is somehow worse than its previous installments ‚Äúagain‚Äù! 
Every annoying aspect of the previous game are still here but now somehow worse and more broken.
On my very first play; playing as the bulls vs the suns just to get a feel for the game the announcer said ‚ÄúPACERS 3!!!‚Äù and ‚ÄúPACERS BASKET!‚Äù it was funny for being so confidently wrong; but then it happened again and again in multiple games; so it seems that the Bull arena simply has a broken PA announcer.
I‚Äôm surprised I can‚Äôt find anyone else with the same issue honestly considering I‚Äôm buying this game and it's already been out for 6 months.
There are other weird sound oddities some that again are imported from old games such as when playing as the lakers on the lakers home court you can hear a heckler say ‚ÄúLakers go home!!‚Äù It‚Äôs just again odd and confusing; was this soundbyte mean to be added when they are away but got entered into the wrong subfolder?  Why have I been hearing this sound-byte for 3+ years while playing at the laker's home?  Am I insane for even thinking these things?
So there is a tone of immersion-breaking stuff maybe par for the course with NBA 2k but these are NEW issues something that has been ADDED.  Issues that the previous game did not have!  Another annoying quirk I found is some reason they have changed the animation for players that are setting a screen; now they stick their ass out really far it just looks odd/off.. particularly when the play ends up being a double horn screen and two players will run to the 3 point line just to stick their butts out and stand there awkwardly for nobody.  
And speaking of running plays which is really all I want to do in an offline game of basketball; the playcalling menu is horrendous.  I have been dealing with this menu for many years now and I know it‚Äôs a broken system but it‚Äôs a broken system that I learned to navigate; where to run a simple play you may have to push up to four face buttons just to select the play you want to run; well this year they made it worse.
For starters when going into the ‚ÄúOffensive gameplan‚Äù menu where you can control things like rebound / tempo and Primary Focus. 
Primary focus is simply broken; in previous years it would have options like ‚Äúrun the offence though Zack Lavine‚Äù if playing for the Bulls for example; but you would also have the option to run the offence though the other positions on the court such as the starting Point guard, Power forward or small forward.  Each position having its own corresponding button.  Well whatever they have done to this menu and all similar menus in regards to running plays are broken; instead of the 5 players and positions; you get ‚ÄúZack Lavine, Zack Lavine, Lanzo Ball, Lanzo Ball, Zack Lavine‚Äù the same two players double and tripled up!  It was already hard enough to somehow navigate this menu in a live ball situation but now you have 0% confidence you can even find or run something similar to what you want; practically annoying that one of their key stars (Derozen) is simply absent from playcalling despite being on the court! 
This issue is duplicated across all the other gameplan menus while on the court.  And yes I know that you can call timeout move the players around put them back on the court go back into the menu and THEN you may be able to find them in the playcalling menu but it costs you a timeout and you CAN‚ÄôT make changes to players and set a new gameplay while in a timeout without it getting the names wrong!! (granted an old 2k20 bug BUT WHY IS THIS STILL THE CASE 3 YEARS LATER)  Also why should this be the case at all! 
I feel like the entire playcalling system needs to be scrapped at this point and redone.
Now with all that being said about SELECTING a play.  When you run the play‚Ä¶ there is a good chance that that itself will also break during the action.
For example, lets say it‚Äôs a ‚Äú2K smart play‚Äù that you quickly selected and it involves a player running to a spot and setting a screen.  If you arrive before or after the exact moment that the game ‚Äúwants‚Äù then no more screen for you; the play is broken the CPU help forgets what they were doing and you are left holding the ball scrambling to create something off a broken play.
If it happened early enough within the 24 seconds; perhaps you can hold down LB to set another screen; well using this button this ALWAYS has to be the centre; not the closest player so the center will run from the other side of the court while you wait despite you having a man there that could have done it in a pinch.  I swear half the time in this game you are battling your own controls as well as the defense.
It really didn‚Äôt take me long to discover all of these glitches; if you look at my playtime I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs under 30 hours at this stage; but I already KNOW this game; I have played the previous installments.  And if you are reading this then I imagine you are in the same position thinking about buying this game.  This is in no way a full price game; it truly is just a roster update and a worse version of 2k20 in many respects.
What are the positives?  Well there are only a few that I have found so far; this year rebounding and box out seems to work.  The shooting system is just OK‚Ä¶ not horrendous not an improvement just a sideways step.  1 on 1 can be more fun than previous games in some situations as players move slower and dribble moves are smaller; so in rare instances, you may do a nice little crossover move to create space and then step back for a jumper; it does feel good when it goes right; but you have to battle so many other broken systems that it feels like too little of a reward. 
Ok that‚Äôs enough for now; so yes; buy it if it‚Äôs 90% off and you want to play basketball otherwise I can‚Äôt recommend it; it‚Äôs a updated roster; the same bugs from the previous games and new bugs to make the old systems worse.

           -Left/right cheese is insane this year though.
 
- Defense: Every aspect of defense this year except for chase down blocks was laughably bad. When I play defense I shouldn't be sliding as much as I do, and paint defense is wayyyy to inconsistent. - Server latency: Yes the servers are not on the same level as Valorant, Dota, or other games where reactions and adjusting are the biggest factors. 2K servers have always been known to be horrendous but this years weren't as bad as normal. Playing NBA games on MyCareer isn't bad until you have to deal with AI switching for no apparent reason, taking bad shots, going out of bounds, and fucking up plays because the AI suddenly wants to dribble and ignore your calls to pass the ball, no matter how open you are. If you're trailing in the 4th quarter, expect the AI to start chucking up terrible three pointers and drive to a congested paint. The teammate AI is stupid.

From point guard ballhogs, left and right cheese, terrible defense mechanics, and bad team play/trolling such as not passing the ball to open teammates and dribbling the ball for 22 seconds, then passing the ball to someone else to avoid getting a turnover on their stats. But I haven't even touched on the cheating, the main thing that's killing the 2k's PC community.

From the park, where you can view the 60 overall players who are level 40 and do nothing but shoot threes or do flashy dunks, to the rec center where you have 5 stacks of these same players that include the 7'3, 290 lbs center with 99 stats all the way around, you can't escape the cheating. This game saved my life.

I am 37.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

I am an old man - 50 years old - been playing NBA games since the days of Double Dribble on the NES - and, while certainly not even remotely close to my cup of tea, the music is just ear cancer. When a basketball player gets into ‚Äúthe zone,‚Äù people say it can feel like time slows to crawl. They can see things before they happen, every little detail about their opponent stands out, and the rim seems to get bigger and more inviting. NBA 2K22 never quite managed to get me all the way into the zone, but the improved gameplay and breadth of content of this iteration get it closer than it‚Äôs been for the past few years. From important changes to how stamina impacts shooting to a City filled with diverse ways to improve your MyPlayer character, 2K22 feels like a breath of fresh air compared to 2K21.
NBA 2K22 has made some important tweaks to the on-court action that help make it play like a more realistic game, most noticeably how it handles stamina loss while dribbling. In 2K21, it was easy to run at a defender on the perimeter, hit a Curry slide, and drain a three without breaking a sweat. Against the CPU, that tactic was almost undefendable, especially in MyTeam where player cards were quickly made ridiculously overpowered. With 2K22, you can still employ tactics like that, but the stamina loss you suffer from sprinting and doing dribble moves is made much more significant to balance out its effectiveness.
As your player gets more tired their shot meter will shrink, making it tougher to hit shots. That leads to a game that initially seems slow compared to 2K21 ‚Äì but if you play under more control and don‚Äôt just hold that sprint button, you‚Äôll actually have an easier time putting the ball into the bucket because of your larger shot meter. It may not seem like an important change at first, but it leads to a playstyle that feels closer to real life than 2K21 ever did.

This game sucks. I got it for $10 and I would not do it again. I'm not someone who's super into NBA or the card-driven design of many sports games (FIFA, Madden, etc). I'm a casual sports fan who just wants a casual game to be able to sit down and play. I like career modes, both player and GM, in most sports games because it's a fun thing to pick up and play for a few minutes and then put down. 

This game doesn't have that. It's not possible to play Career Mode as a player without microtransactions, because you're able to take your player online and play against others. That's a neat feature - make it optional! I don't want to have to pay $50 to take my created player from a 55 OVR to an 80 OVR just to be able to compete in the NBA, offline. I don't care about playing other players - anyone I play online will beat me, since they're hardcore. Just let me play offline without my needing to spend extra money. I got so frustrated by this that I eventually did pony up $50 for 200k VC and upgrade my player to an 80. It still feels like I can't do anything. A slasher point guard can't make a single contested layup? Really??

Additionally (and many sports games of the last few years have been suffering from this) it's very very hard to play this game as a casual player. There are animations I have to use, complex controls to memorize - it's not beginner friendly at all. Even taking the shot off of the right stick (and setting it to dribble only), I still feel like I keep messing up and losing the ball. I get that these controls allow for more skill expression at higher levels of play, but that isn't me.

This is my first venture into NBA games, really basketball games at all. 

I grew up playing the Madden series and there are bugs from the early 2000s that they still havent fixed (like arms/legs phasing thru the player or spinning 360 degrees). 

I had assumed that this is what all sports games are and really had no interest in playing. Then I started to watch NBA games and I wanted to learn more. So I bought this game. 

It is absolutely phenomenal in my book. The MyTeam section feels like mid-2000s Madden games, up until current ones, with the card collection and it is fun to collect them as well, without feeling like you need to spend a lot of real world money on packs due to the auction house. 

The MyPlayer mode is phenomenal as well. There was only one year of Madden that I remember with a career mode similar, but the story/interviews were all text based. I loved that mode and this delivers that in spades. Skipping to the action is easy as well. 2 button presses to skip to the action, or one button press to see when you are going into the game/what situations your are being subbed in for. 

I feel like by doing, I have learned a lot, and for that I am thankful and looking forward to next season!

I'm a huge basketball fan, both in real life and in the NBA 2K franchise. I can say that it was entertaining, but I still cannot recommend people to buy it. Here's what I'm going to say about this game.
- Microtransactions system -
This is a long-standing issue for this game series. Every franchise's game tries to include a top-up system that allows players to improve their character's attributes. The character attribute system is known as the game's heart. If the character is not upgraded, the movement will be significantly slowed. Furthermore, scoring points by shooting or close range is still difficult. In addition, the VC collecting still extremely unbalanced. Even you can play the hardest difficulty, but the reward is only a small amount. You'll spend most of your life upgrading your character's attributes without going through the multiplayer fun. 
**With this microtransaction structure, there is a risk of bias in the different divisions of gamers. The player with the most attribute points have high chances wins, and new players who have not been able to fully upgrade their attributes will lose.**
- AI system -
Another aspect that irritates me greatly is the AI system. This game's AI, in my opinion, is worse than the previous one, and it is completely untrustworthy. The AI algorithm can only think of running into the inner circle to shoot through the hoop while ignoring your opponent's obstacles. Furthermore, notable players such as Stephen Curry nearly did not make any single three-point shot. The other characters turned out to be three points more accurate than him.
- Network and connection issues - 
I don't have any connection issues, but everything seems to take forever on the court. The character reacts very slowly, and I can do almost nothing to assist my teammates; however, my character performs much better on MyCareer. 

**CONCLUSION**
"If this letter reaches the developer, I'd like to inform them that you did not finish the game. You're also in desperate need of cash. The game should not be released every year, but rather should be the only high-quality game available." 
***Not worth full price, please buy on discount only.***  ((I warned you..))

An Easy Cheesecake Recipe Perfect for Beginner Cheesecake Makers!
Cheesecake is one of those recipes that can be intimidating but it doesn‚Äôt have to be. Making cheesecake at home can be super simple with the right technique and attention to detail. In this post I‚Äôm going to show you how to make the best old-fashioned cheesecake ever with step-by-step instructions.

There is nothing complicated about this recipe, which is just the way I like it. What you will end up with is creamy cheesecake and a buttery, delicious graham cracker crust.

What‚Äôs even better about this recipe, is once you‚Äôve tried it, you will see that it‚Äôs totally open to be adapted. You can change the crust, or mix in fun things like cookie dough, or swirl it with caramel or fudge. It‚Äôs truly the last cheesecake recipe you will need. (Update: I even created a chocolate cheesecake based on this recipe after so many requests, so make sure to check that out, if chocolate is your thing!)

What‚Äôs in this Cheesecake?
Let‚Äôs start with a quick look at the ingredients for this cheesecake recipe. (See the recipe card at the bottom of this post for amounts.)

There is nothing complicated here! Simple ingredients often make the most amazing desserts. Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll need:

For the graham cracker crust:

graham crackers
butter
sugar
salt
For the cheesecake filling:

cream cheese
sugar
sour cream
vanilla extract
eggs
Now how to make it: 
Step 1: Bring Your Ingredients to Room Temperature
The first thing you will need to do before you make this recipe is take all your ingredients out a few hours before you plan on making your cheesecake. The way to ensure the cheesecake will bake perfectly is for everything to be at room temperature! I know this can be annoying, but trust me‚Ä¶I want you to succeed!
Step 2: Make Your Graham Cracker Crust
For this classic cheesecake recipe, we are sticking with the standard graham cracker crust. Make sure your graham cracker crumbs are finely ground. You can use a food processor or blender to do this.

Then mix your crumbs with melted butter, granulated sugar, and a little kosher salt.
Press this into the bottom and halfway up the sides of a 9- inch springform pan. I use the bottom of a glass to do this step.  A springform pan is a necessity when making cheesecake. The sides are easily removed and your cheesecake will be perfectly intact.
I like to pre-bake my crust. I have found that pre-baking lends a crispier, sturdier graham cracker crust. It only bakes for 8-10 minutes, and you can also do this step in advance!

Step 3: Make Your Cheesecake Filling
Like I said, make sure that all of your ingredients are at room temperature. Not only will this ensure it bakes perfectly, it will also prevent your cheesecake batter from being lumpy. If you try and mix the filling up with cream cheese that isn‚Äôt quite room temperature, you will get lots of lumps. A few lumps is perfectly fine, too many lumps will change the texture.
Another huge tip is to NOT over mix the cheesecake. Over mixing will incorporate too much air into the filling and cause it to crack as it‚Äôs baking. Over baking will also cause cracking too, but we will get to that in a minute.
You will need 4 packages of cream cheese for this cheesecake recipe.

Just spread the cheesecake filling on top of the crust and smooth it out using a spatula or an offset spatula.
Step 4: Bake Your Cheesecake
Baking the cheesecake is where most people start to feel intimidated. There are a lot of stories out there about how hard it is to make a cheesecake, mostly because cheesecake is traditionally baked in a water bath. But I‚Äôm here to tell you: baking a cheesecake in a water bath is EASY! You just have to follow my simple technique below.

Why are cheesecakes baked in a water bath? Because with cheesecake the goal is to bake it slowly and evenly without browning or cracking the top. A water bath lets you  insulate your cheesecake so that the outside doesn‚Äôt bake too quickly. It also helps keep the oven moist. End result: perfectly baked, moist cheesecake that is all kinds of creamy deliciousness!
How to Bake a Cheesecake in a Water Bath ‚Äì Easy Method!
First, DOUBLE wrap the bottom of your pan in foil. You bake a cheesecake in a water bath, and the foil is just a preventative measure so water doesn‚Äôt leak in and cause your crust to get soggy!
Now, carefully place your cheesecake into the oven and allow it to bake for 60 -70 minutes. Don‚Äôt open your oven constantly. I know it‚Äôs tempting to see how the cheesecake is baking, but opening the oven can reduce the oven temperature and interfere with the baking process. Wait until the 60 minute mark before you check your cheesecake.

Here‚Äôs how to tell if your cheesecake is done baking once you check it: The outside should be set, while the inside should jiggle ever so slightly. This means it‚Äôs done. If you bake the cheesecake long enough that the center is set, it is over baked. Over baking ALSO causes cracking, which is what you‚Äôre trying to avoid.

But please, if you do get a little cracking, all is not lost! This is when you break open a can of cherry pie filling and turn that cheesecake into a cherry cheesecake!
Step 5: Chill Your Cheesecake
How long does it need to chill?
Allow the cheesecake to cool at room temperature for about an hour. THEN cover the pan with foil and it will need to chill in the refrigerator for at least 6 hours, but preferably overnight.
When you‚Äôre ready to enjoy your hard work, remove the cheesecake from the refrigerator. If any condensation has built up on top of your cheesecake, just take a paper towel and dab the moisture off. Then slice it and enjoy the fruits of your labor!

Updated review: I feel like it's very important people realize 2K22 is literally pay to win - unless you love grinding & losing a lot starting out until your player gets better.  The only way to avoid that is buying VC & upgrading your character as much as the game will let you out of the gate.  That makes it much more enjoyable.  At the current price I would say it is worth buying (nine dollars and fifty nine cents).

I mostly play MyCareer mode, my char is currently on the Miami Heat in my 3rd season of play after being traded my rookie year because I wasn't getting a starting position/enough minutes on the team that drafted me 9th overall.  I have molded the Heat in to a team that's both entertaining to watch when I'm on the bench, be it with fouls or because we're up by 30, as well as being impossible to beat unless I mess around & lose on purpose.  My current lineup is myself, Jokic, Zion Williamson, Bam Adebayo, & Jimmy Butler starting, with Tyler Herro, Bol Bol (the big boi!), Chris Paul (still don't understand how he even got here in the middle of the 2021-2022 season) and then some roster filling role players that change regularly.  

I run myself at SG, Jokic at Center, Zion at PF, Jimmy at SF & Bam Adebayo at PG - we have had runs where we double the other team's score at half time on a regular basis since this lineup got in town.  I am enjoying the game very much now, but that's to be expected when my Char is a 97 overall on a team that's that stacked.  I'm looking forward to 3-peating this season as champions, and I'm planning on not signing a new contract & switching teams after my contract expires, see how many different teams I can win Chips on before retiring.

Original Review: Do not buy this game. It's literally pay to win.  Unless you're god's gift to computerized basketball, good fucking luck winning without spending money on VC to boost your character for MyCareer out of the gate.  I may be new to the game & have no fucking clue what I'm doing, but I have a MyPlayer with a 95 rated 3-point shot who is somehow missing 66% of the time despite me timing shots within a slither of the exact line you're supposed to hit.

How anyone can win the College Tournament without spending VC I don't know, I don't even think it's possible.  I'm stuck in the Semi-Finals, have tried to play the game about 15 times now, every fucking time I get ahead & my team either blows the lead when I go to the bench, or my team miraculously starts missing every single shot until the other team catches up & takes the lead.  This has happened in half the attempts so far, the other half I start out hot from 3, 3/4 or 4/5 then suddenly none of my shots will go in until the other team gets the lead.

Edit: Finally beat the Semi-Final game through sheer dumb luck I think, again I was up by 8, other team comes back to tie, then it magically let me hit some 3s again and we won.  

Explain to me HOW a 95-rated 3 point shooter can go 7/28 after starting 4/5 from 3?  Shouldn't be possible right? With this game it is.

Oh, and the PC online PvP scene is literally cheater-riddled bullshit.  Don't even bother unless you're going to play with friends only.
